Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery eye-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; top of rim glazed; exterior: band near rim; below, four dots and a short vertical forming the forehead above the eyes, above pair of eyebrows and part of eyes with added red and added white; ancient repair hole on left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as two other joining sherds designated as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.1053 and AN1896-1908-G.1053(3) for clarity.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0602) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
